column7: 彼は素晴らしい実績を持っています。
column8: He has outstanding achievements.
column9: Kare wa subarashii jisseki o motteimasu.
column10: Refers to actual results or achievements.

column7: 彼女の人柄はとても素晴らしいです。
column8: Her personality is wonderful.
column9: Kanojo no hitogara wa totemo subarashii desu.
column10: Refers to someone's character.

column7: 自主性を大切にしています。
column8: I value independence.
column9: Jishusei o taisetsu ni shiteimasu.
column10: Often used in educational contexts.

column7: ビジネスの世界において重要な役割を果たす。
column8: He plays an important role in business.
column9: Bijinesu no sekai ni oite jūyō na yakuwari o hatasu.
column10: Used in formal contexts, not as common as "で".

column7: ドーピングはスポーツで禁止されています。
column8: Doping is banned in sports.
column9: Dōpingu wa supōtsu de kinshi sareteimasu.
column10: Refers to drug use in sports.

column7: 彼は大会に出場する予定です。
column8: He is scheduled to participate in the competition.
column9: Kare wa taikai ni shutsujou suru yotei desu.
column10: Often used for competitions or events.

column7: 交通が封鎖されています。
column8: The traffic is blocked.
column9: Kōtsū ga fūsa sareteimasu.
column10: Often used for physical blockages.

column5: to be hit by a disaster/to suffer from a disaster
column7: 地震で被災しました。
column8: I was affected by the earthquake.
column9: Jishin de hisai shimashita.
column10: Used in the context of natural disasters.

column7: 彼は無実です。
column8: He is innocent.
column9: Kare wa mujitsu desu.
column10: Often used in legal contexts.

column7: 警察が捜査を行っています。
column8: The police are conducting an investigation.
column9: Keisatsu ga sōsa o okonatteimasu.
column10: Used in legal or police contexts.

column5: to see/to notice/to judge/to admit/to accept
column7: 彼は自分のミスを認めました。
column8: He admitted his mistake.
column9: Kare wa jibun no misu o mitomemashita.
column10: Can mean to admit or acknowledge.

column7: ルール違反で失格になった。
column8: He was disqualified for breaking the rules.
column9: Rūru ihan de shikkaku ni natta.
column10: Commonly used in competitions.

column7: 彼は事業の下地を作り始めた。
column8: He started laying the groundwork for the business.
column9: Kare wa jigyō no shita-ji o tsukuri hajimeta.
column10: Refers to foundational work or preparation.

column7: 彼の国籍は日本です。
column8: His nationality is Japanese.
column9: Kare no kokuseki wa Nihon desu.
column10: Refers to one's country of citizenship.

column7: すべての有権者が投票に行きました。
column8: All the voters went to the polls.
column9: Subete no yūkensha ga tōhyō ni ikimashita.
column10: Used in political contexts.

column7: みんなで合唱をした。
column8: We sang together in a chorus.
column9: Minna de gasshō o shita.
column10: Often used in musical or group settings.

column7: 空き巣に入られた。
column8: We were robbed by a burglar.
column9: Akisu ni irareta.
column10: Refers to burglars who break into houses.

column7: 防犯対策を強化しています。
column8: We are strengthening crime prevention measures.
column9: Bōhan taisaku o kyōka shiteimasu.
column10: Refers to security measures to prevent crime.

column7: 警察がパトロールしている。
column8: The police are patrolling.
column9: Keisatsu ga patorōru shiteiru.
column10: Often used in police or security contexts.

column7: その結果が如何にであるかが問題です。
column8: What the outcome will be is the problem.
column9: Sono kekka ga ikan ni de aru ka ga mondai desu.
column10: Formal, used in question forms.

column7: いかにも彼らしい行動です。
column8: It is certainly like him to act this way.
column9: Ikanimo karera-shī kōdō desu.
column10: Emphasizes certainty or obviousness.

column7: 彼の答えはあやふやでした。
column8: His answer was vague.
column9: Kare no kotae wa ayafuya deshita.
column10: Describes something unclear or ambiguous.

column7: 会社は他の企業と提携しています。
column8: The company is cooperating with other companies.
column9: Kaisha wa hoka no kigyō to teikei shiteimasu.
column10: Often used in business contexts.

column7: 医療技術は進歩しています。
column8: Medical technology is advancing.
column9: Iryō gijutsu wa shinpo shiteimasu.
column10: Refers to health-related services.

column7: 事情があって遅れました。
column8: I was late due to circumstances.
column9: Jijō ga atte okuremashita.
column10: Refers to reasons or background conditions.

column7: 彼は大きな器を持っています。
column8: He has great capacity.
column9: Kare wa ōkina utsuwa o motteimasu.
column10: Can refer to both physical containers and personal qualities.

column7: 彼は反対を押し切って計画を実行した。
column8: He pushed through the opposition and carried out the plan.
column9: Kare wa hantai o oshikiratte keikaku o jikkō shita.
column10: Often used when facing resistance or challenges.

column5: to break in/to squeeze someone or something into
column7: 彼は部屋に押し込まれた。
column8: He was shoved into the room.
column9: Kare wa heya ni oshikomareta.
column10: Can also mean squeezing into a tight space.

column5: to drive someone or something into
column7: 彼を corner 追い込んだ。
column8: He was driven into a corner.
column9: Kare o oikonda.
column10: Used when someone is forced into a difficult situation.

column7: パーティーは華やかでした。
column8: The party was splendid.
column9: Pātī wa hanayakadeshita.
column10: Often used for celebrations, events, or appearances.

column7: 今年の売上は去年を上回った。
column8: This year's sales exceeded last year's.
column9: Kotoshi no uriage wa kyonen o uwamawatta.
column10: Often used for surpassing expectations.

column7: 売上は予想を下回った。
column8: Sales fell below expectations.
column9: Uriage wa yosō o shitamawatta.
column10: Commonly used in business or financial contexts.

column7: 彼女の背景について知っている。
column8: I know about her background.
column9: Kanojo no haikei ni tsuite shitteiru.
column10: Refers to both literal and figurative background.

column7: 彼は新しい技術の特許を取った。
column8: He got a patent for the new technology.
column9: Kare wa atarashī gijutsu no tokkyo o totta.
column10: Refers to legal patents or exclusive rights.

column7: 二人はその問題で揉めている。
column8: The two are fighting over the issue.
column9: Futari wa sono mondai de mometeiru.
column10: Often used for personal disputes or arguments.

column7: 総理大臣は記者会見を開いた。
column8: The Prime Minister held a press conference.
column9: Sōri daijin wa kishakaiken o hiraita.
column10: Title for the head of government in Japan.

column7: 鶴は長寿の象徴です。
column8: The crane is a symbol of longevity.
column9: Tsuru wa chōju no shōchō desu.
column10: Often used in cultural or national symbols.

column7: 大きな吹雪が街を襲った。
column8: A huge snowstorm hit the town.
column9: Ōkina fubuki ga machi o osotta.
column10: Commonly used in winter weather contexts.

column7: 彼女の夢は儚いものだった。
column8: Her dream was fleeting.
column9: Kanojo no yume wa hakanai mono datta.
column10: Often used to describe something fleeting or temporary.

column7: 彼女は観客を魅了した。
column8: She fascinated the audience.
column9: Kanojo wa kankyaku o miryō shita.
column10: Can be used for both objects or people that captivate attention.

column7: 彼との出会いには深い由縁がある。
column8: There is a deep connection to my encounter with him.
column9: Kare to no deai ni wa fukai yuen ga aru.
column10: Often used for connections or significant reasons behind events.

column7: この言葉の語源は何ですか？
column8: What is the origin of this word?
column9: Kono kotoba no gogen wa nan desu ka?
column10: Used in linguistic contexts.

column5: haiku (a Japanese poem with three lines consisting of five, seven, and five syllables)
column7: 彼は俳句が得意です。
column8: He is good at haiku.
column9: Kare wa haiku ga tokui desu.
column10: Refers to the traditional Japanese form of poetry.

column7: 花が散る季節が好きだ。
column8: I like the season when flowers scatter.
column9: Hana ga chiru kisetsu ga suki da.
column10: Often used for flowers or things that spread out.

column7: 彼は彼女に心酔している。
column8: He is infatuated with her.
column9: Kare wa kanojo ni shinsui shiteiru.
column10: Describes a deep passion or obsession.

column7: 私たちの間柄は長い歴史があります。
column8: We have a long history in our relationship.
column9: Watashitachi no aidagara wa nagai rekishi ga arimasu.
column10: Describes personal relationships or connections.

column7: この文化は固有の特徴を持っている。
column8: This culture has unique characteristics.
column9: Kono bunka wa koyū no tokuchō o motteiru.
column10: Used to describe something inherent or native.

column7: 従来の方法ではうまくいかなかった。
column8: The traditional method did not work.
column9: Jūrai no hōhō de wa umaku ikanakatta.
column10: Often used to refer to past methods or conditions.

column7: 彼はその武器を所持していた。
column8: He was in possession of the weapon.
column9: Kare wa sono buki o shoji shiteita.
column10: Used in legal contexts for holding or possessing items.

column7: 騒がしい場所では勉強できない。
column8: I can't study in noisy places.
column9: Sawagashii basho de wa benkyō dekinai.
column10: Used to describe loud or chaotic environments.

column7: 人々がずらっと並んでいる。
column8: The people are lined up in a row.
column9: Hitobito ga zuratto narandeiru.
column10: Used to describe things or people lined up or in order.

column7: ずばり言ってください。
column8: Please say it directly.
column9: Zubari itte kudasai.
column10: Used to express something bluntly or directly.

column7: 彼の切実な願いを聞いた。
column8: I heard his earnest wish.
column9: Kare no setujitsu na negai o kiita.
column10: Refers to something urgent or deeply felt.

column7: 彼は木の枝を束ねた。
column8: He bundled the branches together.
column9: Kare wa ki no eda o tabaneta.
column10: Often used for binding things together, like ropes or bundles.

column7: 健康を保つために運動をしています。
column8: I exercise to maintain my health.
column9: Kenkō o tamotsu tame ni undō o shiteimasu.
column10: Used for maintaining or keeping something in a state.

column7: この街には多様な文化があります。
column8: This city has various cultures.
column9: Kono machi ni wa tayō na bunka ga arimasu.
column10: Used to describe variety or diversity.

column7: つくづく人生は不公平だと感じる。
column8: I deeply feel that life is unfair.
column9: Tsukuduku jinsei wa fukōhei da to kanjiru.
column10: Often used for expressing deep feelings or realizations.

column7: 彼は自分の信念を貫き通した。
column8: He stuck to his beliefs.
column9: Kare wa jibun no shinnen o tsuranikuita.
column10: Refers to following through or staying true to something.

column7: 言葉の定義を明確にする。
column8: Clarify the definition of the word.
column9: Kotoba no teigi o meikaku ni suru.
column10: Often used in academic or explanatory contexts.

column7: この説明は紛らわしいです。
column8: This explanation is confusing.
column9: Kono setsumei wa magirawashii desu.
column10: Used to describe things that are unclear or misleading.

column7: 彼は惨めな生活を送っている。
column8: He is living a miserable life.
column9: Kare wa mijime na seikatsu o okutteiru.
column10: Describes extreme sadness or a poor state of affairs.

column7: 夜更けに外を歩くのは危険です。
column8: Walking outside late at night is dangerous.
column9: Yofuke ni soto o aruku no wa kiken desu.
column10: Refers to the late hours of the night.

column5: staying up late/to stay up late
column7: 彼は夜更かしをしてしまった。
column8: He stayed up late.
column9: Kare wa yofukashi o shite shimatta.
column10: Describes staying awake past a usual bedtime.

column5: to place/to fix/to settle/to seat/to put
column7: その椅子を部屋の隅に据えてください。
column8: Please place the chair in the corner.
column9: Sono isu o heya no sumi ni suete kudasai.
column10: Often used for fixing or placing something in position.

column7: 彼の態度は悩ましいものだった。
column8: His attitude was perplexing.
column9: Kare no taido wa nayamashii mono datta.
column10: Used for situations or feelings that are complicated or frustrating.

column7: 健やかな生活を送っている。
column8: I lead a healthy life.
column9: Sukoyaka na seikatsu o okutteiru.
column10: Refers to physical or mental health.

column7: この部屋にはゆとりがあります。
column8: This room has plenty of space.
column9: Kono heya ni wa yutori ga arimasu.
column10: Refers to having ample space or time.

column7: 余程疲れているようだ。
column8: You seem very tired.
column9: Yohodo tsukareteiru yō da.
column10: Used for emphasis, to express a great degree.

column7: 彼は大きな野心を持っている。
column8: He has big ambitions.
column9: Kare wa ōkina yashin o motteiru.
column10: Refers to someone's desire for success or achievement.

column7: 彼はくすぐったいので笑ってしまう。
column8: He laughs because he is ticklish.
column9: Kare wa kusuguttai node waratte shimau.
column10: Used to describe the sensation of being tickled.

column7: その計画はもどかしいほど進まない。
column8: The plan is frustratingly slow.
column9: Sono keikaku wa modokashī hodo susumanai.
column10: Describes situations that cause impatience or frustration.
